Reviews.Title: “If you're in Berlin, stay here.”
Reviews.Author: Paul N
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Motel One in February and to quote the film Lock Stock;' it's a deal, it's a steal, it's the sale of the f-ing century'. Great, friendly service, lovely, modern en suite rooms and really low prices in the hippest quarter of Berlin. In London or even Warsaw you'd pay $300 for this. Here you pay 60 to 80 Euros. I even checked out late and didn't get charged. I will always stay in this hotel or the Motel One on An der Urania Strasse when I'm in Berlin. Full marks for the traveller who wants comfort, service and good value. It's Berlin's best kept hotel secret. It's very laid back and the service is efficient but not in your face, which is how it should be. I'd just like to add, I didn't eat there as I was out partying most of the time, so I haven't reviewed any food!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and good budget hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: travelingokgal
Reviews.Content: Motel One was very clean and comfortable with minimal amenities...a good budget hotel in a great location. The breakfast is really good!

Reviews.Title: “A very good choice”
Reviews.Author: Paul B
Reviews.Content: I really like staying in the hotels of the Motel One chain. This was my first stay at the hotel in Kantstrasse, Berlin. I booked a single room but since I arrived late I was given a big family room with a view at Zoo station. The location of the hotel ist perfect. Just a 1 minute walk and you are at the Zoo station which is perfect to catch trains, subways or buses. In the other direction it is a 1 minute walk and you are in the middle of Kurfürstendamm, one of the main shopping areas in Berlin. Lots of restaurants are close by as well. There is free Wlan in the lobby and free Wlan in your room if you book breakfast, which I would recommend because it is a really good breakfast with a small but very good selection and really great coffee. The only thing I miss is a gym. But you can't complain considering the price - and you can go for a run because you are downtown in one of the most interesting citys in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Almost everything that opened and closed”
Reviews.Author: zacstar
Reviews.Content: Great new building and sparkling bathroom. Helpful staff and great KuDamm location. Comofortable bed and openable windows (for once) and good value for money in Berlin too. The things we knew would weren't getting did grate on us finally. No in room phone. No in room wireless (though free wireless available in the VERY swish lobby/bar), tiny TV and no control on aircon/heating. Good Motel One package but we still hoped for a little bit more.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice”
Reviews.Author: Monica001
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with this motel. It is really near the KaDeWe, there are plenty of restaurants not too far away. The room was a little bit too small but with everything you need. And very clean. Nice staff, not only at the reception desk but also in the breakfast lounge. A good choice of marmalade, real nutella (not a no-name cream!). If you have a room on the street side be aware that it could be a little bit loud but the windows are good and you do not hear anything when they are closed.

Reviews.Title: “Poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: thoughtfulphil
Reviews.Content: We decided we would go to Berlin for New Year and was pleasantly surprised that we could get a hotel at a reasonable price that looked quite stylish. Stylistically the hotel looks fine and has been dressed very simply. In terms of location, there are a number of nice bars and restaurants within 10 minutes walk and the excellent trains are also easily accessible within 5 minutes. The journey from the airport was approximately 45 minutes from recollection. Breakfast wasn't included but I believe you could purchase a few things from behind the very small bar but we found a decent coffee shop along the road. The bar itself merged into the reception area and was very sparse in terms of furniture; I don't think it would take very long for all seating to be taken. Generally it was quite a cold atmosphere in the hotel and didn't feel that welcoming. My issue with the hotel was the service we received. On checking in we discovered we had been given a twin room rather than a double room. On explanation of this to staff they informed me that I should have specifically requested a double room on booking (needless to say a double room was selected on the internet booking form). We were informed as it was New Year's Eve and the hotel was full there were no other double rooms and that we could push the beds together. On asking to speak to the manager we were greeted with huffs of derision and a discussion between staff in German which were accompanied by looks in our direction and, although only speculating, it felt as though we were being ridiculed. A double room was found surprisingly easily to be honest although instead of a double duvet we were provided with two seperate blankets. This whole process took about 30 minutes and it felt as though we had to really press to get what we had booked and were made to feel as if we were in the wrong. The general demeanour of staff was generally quite poor, although we found one receptionist to be particularly helpful in terms of providing insight into trains and generally getting around Berlin. We may have been a little unfortunate in terms of staff not being overly happy with working over the new year period but I would have expected better and needless to say has put me off from using the Motel One brand, which is a pity because they appear to be quite plentiful, reasonably priced and appear quite neutral in their decor.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, clean, pleasant and great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Busybee81
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel conveniently located to combine a business meeting with a little Berlin shopping. The rooms are small and basic, but very clean and pleasantly decorated - if all you need is a good central location, clean comfortable bed and a hot shower - Motel One is a perfect place for a very good price. They also serve good breakfast and the bar downstairs is a nice place to have a drink in the evening before going to bed. I will for sure be staying there or at one of their other locations on my next trip to Germany.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay for a visit in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: poultrip
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights. Arriving by car was easy - parkering house in the same building. Very good place for visiting Kurfürstendam. Easy acces to the S-bahn. Clean rooms - not too big! Fine breakfast. Price reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: saxosammy
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Motel One for three days and was pleasently surprised. Fine rooms, excellent cleaning, and a good (and large) breakfast buffet for only 7½ €. Though it is only at two-star hotel is has everything you need and is probably one of the best hotels for such a low price.

Reviews.Title: “Best one in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: SallyZohney
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel everytime I went to Berlin. its my second home out there. love their style, mix of modern and cozy, the staff are so friendly, breakfast was very good. rooms were always clean even when I got really small ones. It has the best locations in Berlin, this one is walking distance from several Uban stations, main bus stop is 5 minutes away, the Belrin Zoo, the BEST doner is right next door, shopping central area is very close. Its also very affordable. totally recommended. My German friends used to leave their house and come stay with me

Reviews.Title: “Safe location & good value”
Reviews.Author: jmasc1
Reviews.Content: Definitely worth a shot. Will stay at another Motel One in Koeln this summer. Clean but small. Definitely ok if you're out exploring all day. TV practically non-existent - if that's how you need to unwind @ the end of the day. Free wi-fi in lobby. Quick elevators. Nice staff. Decent breakfast - but for almost 7 Euro.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect. Just perfect, if you don't spend all the day in your room.”
Reviews.Author: Lasselanta
Reviews.Content: This place doesn't offer all the aspects of luxury, but the very important one - the air-conditioner. All the other things are necessities, and the package is most satisfying - there is everything you need for a good night rest and a cheerful start of a new day. The building faces the S-Bahn (city railway) station, but you don't hear a sound from the outside, when in your room. The hotel is clean, comfy, conveniently located and not expensive. They serve good breakfast, too. The staff is friendly and helpful. I'll definitely return there, when I am in Berlin next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lawyergirl007
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Motel One Ku'damm in Berlin for four nights while being on a city break in Berlin. This hotel has only two stars, but should have at least three in my opinion. Positive points: - Nice and trendy lobby - Nicely decorated rooms, with comfortable beds and a flat screen. Room was even bigger then I had anticipated. When booking the hotel, because it was only a two star, I was a bit fearfull that the rooms would be the size of a shoebox. However, this is not the case: rooms are a decent size: you easily can spend some time in them relaxing after a day of sightseeing and while preparing for dinner. - Modern, well-equiped bathrooms. - Cleaning was done very thoroughly. - Great breakfast: selection of various rolls and breads, croissant, cheese and cold cuts, boiled eggs. Very good orange juice and excellent latte machiato's. - Although the hotel is located next to the track, you will not hear a thing: great isolation. The rooms directly facing the track even have double windows (not double glazing, but really double windows) - They store your luggage on your last day if you have a late flight: it is kept in a locked room. - Maybe the most important thing: very nice staff, especially the manager who was on duty most of the time during our stay. Originally we were only supposed to stay for three nights. Unfortunately we ended up missing our flight to Brussels due to some problems with Deutsche Bahn (trains to Schönefeld Airport being cancelled, etc.) and we had to stay a full day extra as a result. So we asked the service desk at the airport to phone the hotel to confirm they had rooms avaiable. When we arrived back at the hotel in the city centre, after a gruelling trip with our luggage, the manager was very nice to us and gave us a free upgrade to a superior room. I will recommend this hotel to anyone going to Berlin (and the Motel One chain in general, as I understand they have hotels in various German cities) and when I return to Germany I will certainly choose it again. As for Berlin, it was my first time in this city and I did not know what to expect. I absolutely loved it though. It is a very beautiful city, very cultural, and the shopping is divine. You certainly have to visit the Sony Center at the Potzdamer Platz. Also, you can try to get a private tour of the Reichstag (German parliament): you can e-mail their visitors service and make a request for a tour. If your request gets honored (which is not sure, because the tours are in high demand) you get a ninety minutes free tour with a guide through parts of the Reichstag that are not open to other visitors. Afterwards you can visit the Dome without having to wait in line (which can take up to two hours). We got lucky and were allowed to take the tour and it was great. Furthermore, you should also visit the Neues Museum with the famous buste of Egyptian queen Nefertete. For restaurants, definitely try Tres, a great Spanish restaurant / tapasbar, we stumbled upon one evening. It is located at the Lychener Strasse in the Prenzlauer Berg district. It has the greatest tapas platter and main courses are also very good. I can also recommend Mr Hai at the Savignyplatz, a thai / vietnamese restaurant and Kuchi, in the Kantstrasse which indeed has great sushi.

Reviews.Title: “Brand new, trendy hotel at an excelent location”
Reviews.Author: TravelBugBR
Reviews.Content: Motel One is a low cost, design hotel chain. Lobby with cool blue Egg chair clones and many other design details creates a nice ambience. Ku'damm unit's located just a few minutes walk from Zoo S+U station, which makes very ease to quickly go anywhere in Berlin or Potsdam. Double window glasses isolates completely busy street noise. We didn't take the breakfast since there are plenty of street cafes nearby, but the buffet did seem very tasty. Room is tiny, so it is a convenient option if your goal is to spend most of the time elsewhere but inside!

Reviews.Title: “small but comfortable”
Reviews.Author: regshammy
Reviews.Content: The rooms were clean, even if they weren't big enough. They changed the towels every day, breakfast was not included, but was pretty good. INternet was free in the lobby but you had to get a code. The room was small, but was recently refurbished and was comfortable. There wasnt any ventilation so you had to open the window for some air. It is very well located near the Zoologischer Garten metro station, you can get to the airport in like 30 minutes. Kurfürstendamm is also in the vicinity. I liked the location of the hotel and the cleanliness of it, I didnt like that the rooms were too small, and there were no cipboards for my clothes, so I had to leave from a suitcase for a wekk I was staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, great price, rooms are quite small”
Reviews.Author: seniledelinquent
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a few days in the depths of winter in February and found it great. The location was brilliant , very close to the Zoo station and the hotel's contemporary design is clean and welcoming. The only slight problem for me was the size of the rooms which are only slightly larger than the very comfortable bed. There is very little storage space - especially difficult inthe winter when you need space to hang thick coats/jackets and there was nowhere convenient to put my suitcase, which in the end stayed ont he floor and turned the room into something of an obstacle course. The desk in my room was very small, but just about adeqaute for my computer. There is free wifi in the lobby of hte hotel and pay wifi in the rooms whcih worked well. The breakfast buffet was good - a small but adequate selection of cheese, salalmi, ham cereals and yoghurt and very fresh rolls and the price was very reasonable. There is a small bar but no significant food avaiable during the day evening. However there are many restaurants and cafes nearby and there is a large supermarket on the next block. Overall this is a comfortable budget hotel which I would be happy to recommend.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENET CONTEMPORARY HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: BreconGlesni
Reviews.Content: Excellent contemporary hotel. Good location close to S Bahn, U Bahn and good supermarket. Comfy beds and good service with free Wireless internet in foyer.

Reviews.Title: “compact, stylish, but no frills”
Reviews.Author: GardenerLondon_UK
Reviews.Content: Don't expect a mini bar, an iron, a phone, a bath or even soap - they do a multi-purpose shampoo, which I didn't much like. But do expect a comfortable firm bed, modern fittings, wifi in the lobby, and a good breakfast, with excellent croissants as well as the usual cheese, meat, cereals - and a good fresh fruit salad. And despite the hotel being right beside a train line, I didn't hear a thing in my room.This hotel is very well located for Zoo station, which is also where some of the bus routes from Tegel Airport end up, so I found the location excellent.

Reviews.Title: “really great!”
Reviews.Author: nancyteach
Reviews.Content: everything you need for a great stay in Berlin: super location, great breakfast buffet, friendly reception and good price.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location. Modern. Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Viajero049
Reviews.Content: Great location, 2 blocks from Zoologisher Garten Station (10 minutes Sbahn from FriedricStrs Station). Very modern hotel with beautifull double rooms. Quiet and clean. One thing: they have no refrigerator in the room. but you can go to the lobby and have anything you want in a very friendly space. Excellent for the money. There is always someone to help you. I guess you feel safe staying in hotel like these. Breakfast was a little expensive for my taste (7,50 EUR each).....you can have breakfast for half just 1 block away. Or you have a supermarket 20 mts from the hotel. Go to this hotel. You will not regret it. I´ll be back there. If you go to Berlin, you MUST stay in the Kurfurstendamm zone, the east zone is just for visiting.

Reviews.Title: “Great price, all I needed in a room”
Reviews.Author: gatordoc
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with the Motel One Ku-damm. The room wasn't huge, but big enough to move around in. The bathroom was nicely sized and has a wonderful shower! The room would be confining if one was staying in the room for any length of time, but we used is as a place to sleep while playing tourist in Berlin. No phone in the room and the "desk" is not really useful as a real desk, but with cell phones, who needs a room phone these days? Location is great, next to the Zoo train station, S and U Bahn, airport buses and travel center. Typical German breakfast in the lobby, cold cereals, rolls, meat, cheese, yoghurt, coffee, juice, tea, etc for about 8 Euros. I would certainly stay in this hotel again if I was in Berlin. At least one other reviewer commented on train noise. Our room overlooked the tracks into the Zoo station and if both sets of balcony doors were closed and latched we couldn't hear a thing. If the doors were opened however the train noise was loud and unremitting.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: postoumios
Reviews.Content: First of all this must be THE best located hotel in Berlin a few meters away from metro,S-BAHN & Bus connections make getting around this huge city a breeze. The rooms are small but VERY clean and the service excellent and FAST ,you pay Japanese style (on the day you arrive) but this only speeds out checkout so it is a plus in my book. The hotel charged me a LOWER price than the one I had directly negotiated with them which was amazing! Don't eat breakfast there though it's not worth it w/ so many great breakfast places in the vicinity.

Reviews.Title: “surprise”
Reviews.Author: kzvbw
Reviews.Content: The first time I`ve been in that motel and I was surprised about the atmosphere and service. Excellent location, absolutly fair price for the motel and breakfast, only the room could be a bit bigger.

Reviews.Title: “Great concept!”
Reviews.Author: Tati_SE
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Motel One Ku'damm for a weekend and were very pleased. Our double room was a good size, the bathroom was very good and the reception/lounge area was very nice. The staff was very helpful and friendly, free wifi downstairs is also a big plus! Nothing to complaint, will stay in Motel One when in Berlin next time, it is the best value for money. Loved the concept. And as was mentioned before - great location! If you go to the right along Kantstr. there are many really good restaurants and bars, including Savigny Pl.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and modern, value for money”
Reviews.Author: Nightguest
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Motel One Ku'Damm for 3 nights in Oct (midweek). I was pleasantly surprised to find the hotel very modern looking, in fact exactly like it does in the photos. Room slightly bigger than I expected, floorlength windows. Flatscreen TV with a cozy "fireplace" to fall asleep to. The bed was huge (I had a singleroom) and I slept like a baby. Everything was VERY clean (and I'm fuzzy about these things), bathroom with an excellent shower and stylish in granite. Comfy, thick towels. It was a bit cold in Oct, but since I could turn up/down the heat and AC myself it was excellent. The only downside I guess is the noise from the trains outside. They did not bother me much (earplugs) but if you are a sensitive sleeper they might. I did not have the breakfast so can't say anything about it. Helpfull staff. I lost a bracelet and emailed after I got home and got a prompt reply (sadly it was not found, I probably lost it somewhere else). The area was good, lots of shops and a mall nearby, restaurants, some attractions etc. Easy trainservice to the Schonefeld airport and of course the rest of the city. Internetcafe's nearby and also a internetstation in the lobby for those of us that don't carry laptops. A huge foodstore supermarket right beside the hotel. If you are sensitive about sexshops, maybe stay elsewhere. The Sex museum was right around the corner and some sexshops. This didn't bother me at all, the whole area felt safe to me (however I am very used to big city nights). All in all a great experience for €59 a night without breakfast. Will definitely stay there again next time in Berlin!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad with one MAJOR problem”
Reviews.Author: leigho
Reviews.Content: For the price (€100 for a family room) this Hotel seemed fantastic. The reception man was friendly, the bar/reception area and public corridors were very funky, modern and stylish and the whole place looked very new and clean. We were amazed by the size of the room as it was much bigger than we were expecting. Be warned though the standard rooms looked like they were about a third of the size (i.e. not much bigger than the bed) The bathroom was small but functional with very trendy wash basin and one of the best showers I've ever used in a European Hotel. Plasma screen on wall which also seemed to take DVDs which they don't mention on their site. Breakfast was fine. It was Continental with some cereal as well but mainly yoghurt, rolls and cold meat but for €6.50 per adult and free for the children it was great. They allowed us to check out late (1400) which meant we could leave our luggage whilst we went to the Zoo. It is only a maximum of 5 minutes walk from Zoo Station (seemed like a fairly safe area although we did go past some kind of sex shop and Museum. Not too obvious but my 9 year old daughter was definitely wondering what it was). However the proximity to the Station is this hotels undoing. There are trains stopping just outside the windows constantly. Every minute during the day and almost as frequent until midnight and from 0500. I presume at weekends it will be all night as the trains run through the night. Although they say the rooms are soundproofed I doubt this as the squealing wheels were quite clearly heard as well as some announcements. As all of the rooms seem to be on one side of the hotel I think they will all be affected by this to some degree. Some rooms will be near the end of the platform whilst others will be nearer the bridge but I suspect they will all hear trains rumbling past. Almost everything about this hotel was fantastic, especially for the price, but I am afraid none of this will ever save it from the chronic sound pollution and as such I would never be able to stay there again. Also seeing one of their other properties near Alexanderplatz Station I suspect a lot of their properties are the same and in a City where public transport sometimes runs for 24 hours I think this is a major issue. I accept the hotel is very reasonably priced and you can't expect luxury but the basic requirement of sleeping is very important whatever price you pay. Hope this helps someone.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Stay - Excellent Service!”
Reviews.Author: SalimaTouchal
Reviews.Content: The Motel One Berlin-Ku'Damm is a modern, beautiful and upbeat hotel, located only a few minutes by foot to the public transportation (Bahnhof Zoo), the famous shopping mile Kurfüstendamm, various interesting sights, touring bus stops and lots of great restaurants. We stayed at a good sized double room, which was clearly structured, very clean, light and offered a small but modern shower/toilet. The beds were very comfortable and air conditioning easily adjustable. We only stayed one night, so we didn’t bother, that the room didn’t offer a closet, but only an area where you can hang up your coats and clothes. Also there’s neither a phone nor a safe deposit box in the room, which we didn’t mind either. We experienced the hotel staff to be very friendly and helpful, focusing and responding to our requests at once. We were positively surprised about the big breakfast buffet, which offered coffee, tea, juice, various bred, croissants, and apart the classical bred toppings (butter, jam, honey) also cold cuts, cheese and cereal. On the downside, if you are not used to the city noises you might find it hard to fall asleep, as the hotel is located along the railroad tracks, so ask for a room on the back side facing the Theater. However, all in all a very pleasant and recommendable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel. Shame about the Service”
Reviews.Author: dolles
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a three day break in Sept 07, Had a few issues with the hotel, The rooms are quite compact. We booked a double room but the the room we got had two separate single beds not very romantic for a couple. Service at reception was slow, Staff behind the desk spoke excellent english and were very helpful but waiting time was too long. There was no do not distrub signs in the room and the cleaners kept walking in on us in the morning time at least two or three times each morning from 9am onwards. Felt like we had to rush out of the room to let them get on with it. The corridoors were quite noisy early in the morning seemed to be a lot of doors banging. Also no safe in the room was a big dis-advantage. Not sure if we could use the safe behind reception but you had to wait so long to be served at reception it would have been too much hassle. There was no information booklet in the room to inform you of any of the services in the hotel. My biggest gripe with the hotel was one evening we decided to have a drink in the hotel bar. I queued at the bar while people in front of me got served then the night porter took my order but before he got the drinks together another person approached the bar and he served this person their drinks before me. Then another lady approached the bar and yet again he served this lady before me even though I was at the bar and he had taken my order before either of these two people. At that stage I walked away and told him to cancel the order that I had been waiting too long. The hotel is situated near the Kudamn which is a very up market street in west Berlin, Nice location if you want to spend time shopping for expensive designer labels but if you are more interested in seeing the city like I was. There is no real advantage in staying near the Ku'damn. In my personal experience I wasn't impressed with the restaurants around the area very much. And some of the bars were quite expensive plus didn't have much of a selection of bars. The hotel is situated very close to the Zoo Garten train station it is about 50m away, You can get direct train links to Schönefeld airport from this station which was very convenient. And Berlin Zoo is across the road from the station. Plus most of the main tourist sites are not too far on the S & U bahn systems. This does mean however that a train line runs past the hotel. The windows have very good sound proofing so it did not cause a problem. Could hear the train passing but sounded like it was in the distance when the window was closed. That said we were staying on the west side of the hotel and the line was situated on the East side of the hotel. Rooms have air-con which we didn't need to use, So I am not sure if there is any extra charge or not. Again this is where an information booklet on hotel services would have been handy. The whole hotel is impeccably clean and nicely decorated. Felt the hotel was more business orientated than tourist.

HotelInfo.Name: Motel One Berlin-Ku'damm
HotelInfo.Address: Kantstrasse 7-11a, 10623 Berlin, Germany
